questions.prompt: Which quality allows a distributed system to keep operating even if one node crashes?
questions.explanation: Fault tolerance is the system’s ability to survive a node failure without downtime.

questions.prompt: In role-based access control, permissions are tied to positions rather than individual users.
questions.explanation: RBAC groups permissions under roles, so people inherit access by joining a role.

questions.prompt: List one advantage of designing services around bounded contexts.
questions.answer: It limits the blast radius of changes by encapsulating each domain.
questions.explanation: Bounded contexts map to cohesive models, so updates stay localized.

questions.prompt: Select all telemetry signals that, together, describe the RED method.
questions.explanation: RED focuses on rate, errors, and duration to mirror user impact.

questions.prompt: Which automation pattern pushes code changes to production progressively with guardrails?
questions.explanation: Canarying exposes a small percentage of traffic first to reduce risk.

questions.prompt: Which numeric pair best captures service level objectives?

options.label: Mean time to recovery and budget
Target reliability percentage and measurement window
Cost of goods sold and margin

questions.explanation: An SLO pairs a reliability target with the period the target is evaluated against.

questions.prompt: Which representations correctly capture the expression <t> Alan and Mairi. dreamed.? Select all that apply.
questions.explanation: Valid XML representations must wrap the entire expression in <t> or <term> tags and contain the dreamed verb.

questions.prompt: An XML document has a tree structure. It:

options.label: can have multiple roots and multiple leaves
can have multiple roots or records

questions.explanation: Every well-formed XML document has exactly one root element, while leaves are unconstrained.

questions.prompt: Which requirements must a well-formed XML document meet? Select all that apply.

options.label: There is a single root element.
Each element is properly nested between an opening and a closing tag.
The tags must come from the set pre-defined by W3C.
White space is not allowed in text content.

questions.explanation: Well-formed XML demands exactly one root element and proper nesting/closing of every tag.

questions.prompt: Before writing nodes with XmlTextWriter, which method call is required to properly format the output file?
questions.explanation: WriteStartDocument writes the XML declaration and prepares the writer for subsequent nodes.
XmlTextReader streams nodes one at a time; it does not build a DOM tree in memory.

questions.prompt: In the same XmlTextReader snippet, which line is the only one that loads a node into memory?
questions.explanation: According to the quiz key, the equality check at line (5) is where the desired element is realized for processing.

questions.prompt: If the XmlTextReader code calls reader.MoveToAttribute("author") after Read(), must the node have attributes?
questions.explanation: MoveToAttribute returns false if the attribute is missing; the call itself does not require attributes to exist.

questions.prompt: An XPath expression can end with a function call.
questions.explanation: Functions in XPath are invoked within the expression, not appended as trailing calls.

questions.prompt: Which XML processing model reads one node into memory at a time based on a path expression?
questions.explanation: SAX is an event-driven, streaming API that pulls in a single node at a time.

questions.prompt: What is an advantage of a server-side solution for displaying an XML file in a required format?

options.label: No need to write an XSL style sheet
No special requirement on the Web browser

questions.explanation: Rendering on the server removes browser requirements, so any client can consume the result.

questions.prompt: If your ASP.NET app creates an XML file, where should it be stored within the application domain?
questions.explanation: App_Data is the designated location for data files such as XML generated by the app.

questions.prompt: Which of the following terms is NOT defined in the W3C namespace http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema?
questions.explanation: Elements such as all, complexType, schema, and choice live in the XML Schema namespace; cc:core does not.

questions.prompt: A Document Type Definition (DTD) file:

options.label: defines the syntax of an XML file
defines the structure of an XML schema file
extends the XML schema with more data types

questions.explanation: A DTD declares the legal structure and elements for an XML document.

questions.prompt: What is an empty element in XML? Select all that apply.

options.label: An element without text content between the tags
An element that does not need to have an opening tag
An element without a child element

questions.explanation: Empty elements have no textual content or children and can use the self-closing syntax that merges start/end tags.

questions.prompt: What XML processing model reads one node into memory at a time?
questions.explanation: SAX parsers stream XML, delivering one node at a time through events.
